frame.name: Sequence
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe entities that occur in some temporally-ordered sequence. The entities thus have some sort of relation between them that might be described by the Relative_time frame. However, at this time, this frame has no Frame Relation with that frame (though this is still under discussion). Additionally, it should be noted that the words in this frame have a metaphorical link to the words in Shape.
<ex>Describe in detail the <t>sequence</t> <fex name="Entities">of steps taken during an emergency</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Entity1
FE.definition: <def-root>This entity occurs in some sequence with <fen>Entity2</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Entity2
FE.definition: <def-root>This entity occurs in some sequence with respect to <fen>Entity1</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Entities
FE.definition: <def-root>Entities that occur in some temporal order.</def-root>

FE.name: Relation_type
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of the sequence in which the entities occur.
<ex>The study consisted of a <fex name="Relation_type">chronologically varied</fex> <t>SERIES</t> of grotesque heads.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: sequence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a temporal arrangement of entities

lexUnit.name: series.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: entities placed in some temporal order

lexUnit.name: successive.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: occurring in sequence without any intervening entities

lexUnit.name: order.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the arrangement or disposition of people or things according to a particular sequence or method.
